graph_elements.graph¶

This module provides the Graph class for constructing and managing directed or undirected graphs of Node objects and their Connections.

class graph_elements.graph.Graph(directed: bool = False)[source]¶

A directed or undirected graph of nodes and connections.

Parameters:

directed (bool, optional) – If True, construct a directed graph; otherwise undirected. Defaults to False.

nodes¶

A dictionary of node objects, keyed by their node_id.

Type:

dict of str -> Node

connections¶

A list of Connection objects between nodes.

Type:

list of Connection

directed¶

Indicates whether the graph is directed.

Type:

bool

adjacency¶

(Optional) Dictionary for any adjacency structures or custom tracking.

Type:

dict

add_connection(node_a_id, node_b_id, weight=1.0)[source]¶

Add a connection between two existing nodes in the graph.

Parameters:

  • node_a_id (str) – The source node’s ID.

  • node_b_id (str) – The destination node’s ID.

  • weight (float, optional) – A parameter indicating, for instance, the “cost” or “capacity” of the connection. Defaults to 1.0.

Raises:

ValueError – If either node_a_id or node_b_id is not found in the graph.

Return type:

None

add_node(node: Node)[source]¶

Add a single node to the graph.

Parameters:

node (Node) – A node object to be added.

Return type:

None

add_nodes(nodes: list[Node])[source]¶

Add multiple nodes to the graph.

Parameters:

nodes (list of Node) – A list of node objects to be added.

Return type:

None

construct_adjacency()[source]¶

Construct an adjacency matrix representing the graph.

For each connection, the matrix entry [i, j] is set to the weight if the graph is directed or to the weight in both [i, j] and [j, i] if undirected.

Returns:

  • adjacency_matrix (np.ndarray) – A 2D NumPy array where rows and columns are indexed by nodes.

  • node_index (dict of str -> int) – A mapping from node IDs to their row/column index in the matrix.

get_neighbors(node_id: str) → list[Connection][source]¶

Retrieve all connections for a given node.

Parameters:

node_id (str) – The ID of the node whose neighbors to retrieve.

Returns:

A list of connections from the specified node.

Return type:

list of Connection

Raises:

KeyError – If the node_id does not exist in the graph.

get_node(node_id: str) → Node[source]¶

Retrieve a node object by its ID.

Parameters:

node_id (str) – The ID of the node to retrieve.

Returns:

The node object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Node or None
